title: OSM Offline Maps Android Wear
summary: Open Street Maps now at you wrist, online & offline.
description: OSM City Maps for Android Wear allows you to view Open Street Maps (OSM) directly on your Android Wear device. Maps are accessible both in online in offline mode.In online mode the app downloads data directly from OpenStreetMap server.For offline mode you can pre-load maps onto your phone and then transfer them to your wearable for standalone execution (even without phone).Moreover, for each offline map you can add custom pins to mark your personal point of interests. There are 45 pins to choose from, each can be given distinct color and title. Pins will appear on your map on watch.If you are missing a map, please use in-the-app Map Request form and submit your request. Now you can also import a map yourself; instructions are included in the app.We are also introducing route planning feature into the app based on the Graphhooper library. While in testing phase the feature is free to use without limitations on the maps that support navigation.Free version of the app will show a Trial message on the watch screen. This can be removed by buying premium version as in-app purchase.This app does not directly embed maps (apart form simplified world map). All maps are downloaded by user selection. The app uses maps from OpenStreetMap.org project (Open Data Commons Open Database License) and as rendering engine it uses MapsForge library.App offers access to almost 1000 offline cities maps, among them:London,New York City,Paris,Barcelona,Tokyo,Bejing,Berlin,Frankfurt,Warsaw,Lisbon,Dublin,Montreal,Mexico City,Moscow,etc...Should you have any problems using this app - before giving us a bad rating - please contact us at play@travelerpocketguide.comWe will be happy to help you.
descriptionHTML:
OSM City Maps for Android Wear allows you to view Open Street Maps (OSM) directly on your Android Wear device. Maps are accessible both in online in offline mode.

In online mode the app downloads data directly from OpenStreetMap server.

For offline mode you can pre-load maps onto your phone and then transfer them to your wearable for standalone execution (even without phone).

Moreover, for each offline map you can add custom pins to mark your personal point of interests. There are 45 pins to choose from, each can be given distinct color and title. Pins will appear on your map on watch.

If you are missing a map, please use in-the-app Map Request form and submit your request. Now you can also import a map yourself; instructions are included in the app.

We are also introducing route planning feature into the app based on the Graphhooper library. While in testing phase the feature is free to use without limitations on the maps that support navigation.

Free version of the app will show a Trial message on the watch screen. This can be removed by buying premium version as in-app purchase.

This app does not directly embed maps (apart form simplified world map). All maps are downloaded by user selection. The app uses maps from OpenStreetMap.org project (Open Data Commons Open Database License) and as rendering engine it uses MapsForge library.

App offers access to almost 1000 offline cities maps, among them:

London,
New York City,
Paris,
Barcelona,
Tokyo,
Bejing,
Berlin,
Frankfurt,
Warsaw,
Lisbon,
Dublin,
Montreal,
Mexico City,
Moscow,
etc...

Should you have any problems using this app - before giving us a bad rating - please contact us at play@travelerpocketguide.com
We will be happy to help you.
comments: This app is causing connection issues at the system level with my New Balance RunIQ watch (running Android Wear v1). Makes the watch unresponsive to settings commands from the Android Wear app and requires a factory reset for full connectivity restoration. Went through this a couple of times before I found the culprit.
I dont understand why there's only city areas available. If you only need maps of certain area, Viewranger could be a better option and it's basically free.

Works great on LG Watch Sport. This has so much potential! I'd love to see a Breadcrumb trail that stays if you navigate away from the map screen. A way to record and see your trip (gpx?) would be great too. I've purchased the app, keep up the good work. Cheers
Great app, just what I was seeking. The only truly stand alone maps and navigation app for Wear. Pity there aren't more maps or an easier way to generate maps and navigation data.
Fail to see the point. Why not do this by entire state or allow a selected map region to be downloaded similar to Google.

In trial mode the wear app is completely useless. Otherwise it also wouldn't be useful, since it doesn't have city transport navigation, neither car navigation. If this app was made for pedestrians in cities, then you should at least add city transport option. If I'm on foot, and wanna walk somewhere nearby, then why would I need a navigation app? If I'm on foot and wanna travel somewhere, then I'll need transportation options! In the current state of this app is useless and silly.
recentChanges: Now it is possible to import GPX track for reference and have it displayed on the map
Fixed issue with missing streets names. Now if a map contains streets names then they will be shown when zoomed-in.
If your location is outside of the map but you have other map on your watch which covers your location, the app now will propose to switch the map.
